column4: how do I properly even remove my usb stick from linux system?
umount: /media/KINGSTON is not in the fstab (and you are not root)
what shows up in "Computer" in gnome?
I don't see the usb drive on the left side, but on the right side is an item 'Kingston DataTraveler'
right click that and click unmount
when I click on it, I get an error.. can't mount, alreaydy mounted
there's no such option when I rightclick
but how can I browse it in graphical mode
for me, I plug in the USB drive and an icon appears on my dekstop
should I have the usb stick in fstab?
I'm not sure how gnome deals with it
